intro: Bonellia loeflingii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bonellia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Bonellia loeflingii is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid climates.
